entry.title: Integrating SAP IBP with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud for Demand Planning Using CI-DS
entry.content:
Overview

In a two-tier ERP model, SAP IBP (Integrated Business Planning) acts as the centralized planning tool, while SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud serves as the transactional system at the headquarters. This guide outlines how to integrate these systems using SAP Cloud Integration for Data Services (CI-DS) to enable seamless demand planning.

Step 1: Install and Configure CI-DS in the Backend System

  1. Install CI-DS Agent on the backend system (S/4HANA Private Cloud).
  2. Configure the Data Stores in CI-DS to connect to:
    • SAP S/4HANA system (source)
    • SAP IBP system (target)

Configure ‚Äú Define Default values for data Integration Between SAP IBP and SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù

 Step 2: Activate Extractors in SAP S/4HANA

To extract master and transactional data, activate the relevant BW extractors.

 Key Transaction Codes:

TCode

Purpose

RSA9

Transfer Application Component Hierarchy

RSA5

Install SAP-delivered DataSources

RSA6

Display active DataSources

RSA3

Test data extraction

RSA7

Monitor delta queue

RSO2

Create generic DataSources

Execution Flow:

  1. RSA9 ‚Äì Transfer the application component hierarchy.
  2. RSA5 ‚Äì Select and install the required standard extractors.
  3. RSA6 ‚Äì Confirm activation.
  4. RSA3 ‚Äì Test the extractors.

Step 3: View iFlows in CI-DS

Once extractors are activated, corresponding iFlows become available in CI-DS.

  • These iFlows map the data from S/4HANA to IBP.
  • You can customize or schedule them for initial and delta loads.

Step 4: Configure SCPI in S/4HANA Private Cloud

In the S/4HANA system:

  1. Use transaction SCPI to configure the integration.
  2. Set up communication arrangements for:
    • SAP_COM_0008 ‚Äì Business Partner, Customer, Supplier
    • SAP_COM_0009 ‚Äì Product

Step 5: Run Initial and Delta Loads

  • Initial Load: Transfers all relevant master and transactional data.
  • Delta Load: Transfers only the changed data after the initial load.

Step 6: Integrate Master Data to IBP

  • Locations: Plants, storage locations, etc.
  • Materials: Products and product hierarchies.

 

 

Step 7: Validate and Monitor

  • Use RSA3 to test extractors.
  • Monitor CI-DS job logs for success/failure.
  • Use IBP Excel Add-In to verify data load.

entry.title: Re: aATP - Manage Substitution Locations
entry.content:
Hello @AdamHorne 

Thank you for your question.

Consider to consult KBA 3193069 & Manage Substitutions for details on how to proceed. However, the summary is, you do not need to delete and rebuild substitution rules if your scenario changes when you work with manage substitution in public cloud. Please note that each substitution rule is time-dependent. You can inactivate the rule. Thereby you stop it from being applied immediately. By maintaining an end date, the rule remains in your system for audit and reporting reference but is no longer valid after that date. You then create a new rule with the revised substitution chain. This ensures history of previous substitutions is preserved and you can track what rules were valid at different times.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Migration Guide From BOPF to RAP Business Objects
entry.content:
Introduction

With the evolution of SAP development models, Business Object Processing Framework (BOPF) is gradually being replaced by the RESTful ABAP Programming Model (RAP), which provides a more modern, cloud-ready, and Fiori-optimized approach for building business applications. To help developers transition, SAP provides a guided migration procedure that converts CDS-based BOPF Business Objects into RAP Business Objects.

This migration ensures that existing business logic, determinations, validations, and actions can be reused in the RAP model, reducing redevelopment effort while aligning applications with SAP‚Äôs strategic direction. The migration process can be executed in two modes:

  • Simulation Mode ‚Äì to check the feasibility of migration and identify potential errors or warnings.
  • Migration Mode ‚Äì to perform the actual migration of objects.

The following procedure outlines the step-by-step approach for performing this migration, including checking transactional processing (TP) and consumption views, handling transport requests, and reviewing logs to ensure a smooth transition.

Procedure

    1. In your ABAP project, navigate to your CDS based BOPF BO under BOPF Business Objects in the Project Explorer.        

       

       

    2. Open the context menu and choose RAP Business Object   Migrate....

       

    3. In the Migration to RAP Business Objects wizard, select any one of the following modes:
      ÔÇß Simulation- checks and tests for errors and warnings before performing any changes. No object is migrated productively.
      ÔÇß Migration- migrates all the related objects.
       

       

    4. Choose Next.
    5. Check the TP views of the business objects affected by the migration.

      The transactional processing (TP) views display the lists of CDS views containing the transactional processing enabled object model annotations.

    6. Choose Next.
    7. Check the consumption views of the business objects affected by migration.

      The consumption views display the list of CDS views containing the transactional processing delegated annotations.

    8. For migration, select or create a transport request for the objects.
    9. Choose Next.
    10. To start the simulation, choose Finish.
    11. For migration, read the disclaimer in the Disclaimer page and the linked migration documentation carefully as the migrated business object cannot be reverted.

      The simulation log is displayed in the BO Migration Log view. Please read the outcome carefully, as errors or warnings indicate additional manual adjustments after the migration.

    12. To continue with migration, select Continue Migration.
    13. Choose Finish.

The migration log is displayed in the BO Migration Log view. Please read the outcome carefully, as errors or warnings indicate additional manual adjustments after the migration.

Conclusion
Migrating CDS-based BOPF objects to RAP helps modernize applications while reusing existing logic and reducing redevelopment. Always start with simulation to identify issues, carefully review migration logs, and then proceed with the actual migration. This ensures a smooth transition to SAP‚Äôs strategic RAP model.

entry.title: Re: ECC6 upgrade operating system and database
entry.content:
Hi 

1. Could you share your ECC6 support pack(SP) level? As per the SAP note 2807743 minimum support package level is 33.

2. For supporting the DB MS SQL 2019, refer to the SAP Note 2807743

3.  For the SAP on Windows 2019 support, see the SAP note 2751450.

4. For the System copy, check the SAP Note 2779625. You can perform the system copy in MS SQL using the Backup the source DB and restore the DB in the newly built target system, start the SWPM process 

Regards

SS

entry.title: Re: How to save a PDF file with colors
entry.content:
Hi @Tanabe_S ,

This behavior usually happens because the Export to PDF function in the Public Cloud apps is optimized for printing data, not for preserving screen formatting. In early 2024 the export still carried over the CSS styles, but SAP changed the rendering engine in a recent upgrade, so colors and some formatting no longer get exported.

Workarounds you can try:

  • Instead of ‚ÄúExport to PDF,‚Äù use your browser‚Äôs Print ‚Üí Save as PDF option. That captures what‚Äôs actually displayed on screen, including colors.

  • If available, switch to the ‚ÄúPrint‚Äù icon in the app (some apps have it hidden in the ‚ãÆ menu) rather than Export.

  • Use Microsoft Print to PDF or another PDF printer driver while printing the browser page.

  • For repeatable reports, consider Story/Analytic App in SAC where color themes are retained in export.

Until SAP updates the export rendering, the browser print-to-PDF option is the only way to reliably capture on-screen colors.

entry.title: Introducing Favorites and Recent in SAP BTP cockpit ‚Äì A personalized navigation experience
entry.content:
We are happy to announce a new enhancement for the SAP BTP cockpit: Favorites and Recent. This feature provides immediate access to important resources from everywhere in the cockpit. It‚Äôs designed to help you work with more focus and productivity across the multitude of accounts, applications and services.

Why Favorites and Recent
Navigating through cockpit and finding the right access points and resources over and over again can be a tedious activity. With a growing number of subaccounts, service instances and spaces this can get even harder and it is easy to lose track of how to quickly navigate from A to B.

Favorites lets you bookmark your most important resources to save time and cognitive effort.
Recent will show you the resources you recently interacted with so you can pick up your work where you left off.

How it works

Favorites: On all main pages of the cockpit, you‚Äôll find a favorites button on the right side. You can click it to automatically add a favorite into the favorite section. By clicking the favorite button again, the favorite will be removed from the list. Favorites are automatically grouped into resource groups (e.g. Subaccount or Space) to make it easier for orientation. For service instances and subscriptions, the favorite not only saves the page but also provides a direct link to the application or the service dashboard.

Recent: When you interact with or stay a longer period of time on a resource in the cockpit, it will be added to the recent tab. This includes a navigation path to directly access the item, a context helper with details about the subaccount and space (if applicable), and a timestamp showing when the interaction occurred.

Filter and search capabilities are both available for Favorites and Recent and will make your interactions even easier. As Favorites and Recent are now a permanent part of your side navigation, you‚Äôll have quick access to them from anywhere in the Cockpit, keeping everything you need just one click away.

What‚Äôs Next
Your feedback makes all the difference. We‚Äôre always looking for feedback to refine and enhance the experience of SAP BTP cockpit. You can leave quick feedback via the shell bar icon in the cockpit at any given time or join our user research survey.

entry.title: Re: How to hide the table in sap adobe form based on cond...
entry.content:
Hi @Mahil ,

Wrap the table in a subform (e.g. sfTable) and hide that subform when the table has no data.

JavaScript (layout:ready of sfTable):

// hide whole block if the table has no rows or all cells are empty

var hasRows = Table1._Row1.count > 0;
var hasData = false;
if (hasRows) {
for (var i = 0; i < Table1._Row1.count; i++) {
var r = Table1.Row1[i];
if (r.Act.rawValue || r.Material.rawValue || r.Name.rawValue || r.ReqmntQty.rawValue) { hasData = true; break;
}
}
}
this.presence = hasData ? "visible" : "hidden"; 

Notes: Use layout:ready (or initialize) event.

entry.title: Re: Nested parameterised cds view
entry.content:
Hi @anil_lahori2 ,

HANA doesn‚Äôt allow nesting a parameterized view unless all parameters are passed and actually used. Your wrapper CDS is triggering the ‚Äúunused parameter‚Äù error.

Quick fixes:

  • Expose the same parameters in your custom CDS and forward them with real values.

  • Or wrap the standard view in a table function (AMDP) and call it there.

  • Or use a non-parameterized view and filter with a WHERE clause instead.

This removes the SQL Code 7 error.

entry.title: Re: SAP PS - Assigning project types to the project profile not working
entry.content:
We were on S/4HANA 2021 and facing a similar issue with Project Types filtering based on Project Profile.

Follow the SAP Note 2232730: Perform the step of activating the flag PROF_PTYPE_FLG via BADI: PS_FUNCTION_SWITCH method GET_SWITCH, by setting value to 'X' (abap_true)

Then, the relevant configs must be maintained in "Assign Project Types to Project Profile".

This helped to achieve the desired filtering.

entry.title: Re: ABAP: SE41 from dict. naming advice/tip
entry.content:
Hi @jeff_broodwar ,

You can‚Äôt have multiple screen fields with ‚ÄúFrom Dict.‚Äù ticked and still keep different field names ‚Äî the F4 help only works if the field name matches the DDIC reference (like MSEG-MATNR).

If you need several fields, use one reference field (From Dict, e.g. MSEG-MATNR) and then copy the value into your own screen fields, or create a table control/loop over one reference field. Another option is to assign search help manually in PBO via DYNP_VALUES_READ / F4IF_FIELD_VALUE_REQUEST for each custom field.

In short: either use the standard DDIC ref for all, or keep your own field names but code the F4 help yourself.

entry.title: 3rd level child in RAP managed scenario does not navigate to Identification facet
entry.content:
I used Parent->Child->Grandchild relationship in managed RAP Scenario and used the standard create, update, delete. I created V4 UI Service binding and checked the Preview.  All the navigation works except from the 3rd level. When I select one row of Grandchild, it does not show the Identification facet. This issue is not there in V2 UI Service.

Here is the behavior definition and Metadata extension screenshots.

managed implementation in class zbp_i_school unique;
//strict;
with draft;

define behavior for ZI_SCHOOL alias schooldetails
persistent table zschool_det
draft table zschool_det_d

lock master total etag lastchangeddate
authorization master ( instance )
etag master locallastchangeddate
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Edit;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;


  field ( readonly : update ) SchoolId;
  action ( features : instance ) setOpenStatus result [1] $self;

  association _zchild { create; with draft; }


  mapping for zschool_det
    {
      SchoolId   = school_id;
      SchoolName = school_name;
      Location   = location;
      Medium     = medium;
      OpenNow    = open_now;
    }
}

define behavior for ZI_STUDENT alias studentBD
authorization dependent by _zparent
persistent table zstudent_det
draft table zstudent_det_d
lock dependent by _zparent
{

  update;
  delete;

  association _zparent { with draft; }
  association _zgchild { create; with draft; }


  field ( readonly : update ) SchoolId;
  field ( readonly : update ) StudentId;

  mapping for zstudent_det
    {
      StudentId   = student_id;
      SchoolId    = school_id;
      StudentName = student_name;
      Birthdate   = birthdate;
    }
}

define behavior for ZI_SCORE alias scoreBD
authorization dependent by _zparent
persistent table zscore_det
draft table zscore_det_d
lock dependent by _zparent
{

  update;
  delete;

  association _zchild { with draft; }
  association _zparent { with draft; }

  field ( readonly : update ) SchoolId;
  field ( readonly : update ) StudentId;
  field ( readonly : update ) SubjectId;
  field ( readonly : update ) Class;

  mapping for zscore_det
    {
      Class       = class;
      SchoolId    = school_id;
      StudentId   = student_id;
      SubjectId   = subject_id;
      SubjectName = subject_name;
      Marks       = marks;
    }

}
@Metadata.layer: #CORE

@UI: { headerInfo: { typeName: 'Subject', typeNamePlural: 'Subjects',
                     title: { type: #STANDARD, label: 'Subject Det Title', value: 'SubjectName' } } }
annotate view ZC_SCORE with
{

  .facet: [ { position: 10, label: 'Score Detail', purpose: #STANDARD,
                     type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE } ]


  : { lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Subject ID' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 10, label: 'Subject ID'  }]  }
  SubjectId;

  : { lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Class' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 20, label: 'Class'  }]  }
  Class;

  : { lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Student ID' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 30, label: 'Student ID'  }]  }
  StudentId;


  : { lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'School ID' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 40, label: 'School ID'  }]  }
  SchoolId;

  : { lineItem: [{ position: 50, label: 'Subject Name' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 50, label: 'Subject Name'  }]  }
  SubjectName;


  : { lineItem: [{ position: 60, label: 'Score' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 60, label: 'Score'  }]  }
  Marks;

}

Please let me know what I am missing? Let me know if you need more code details.

There are some examples of the combinations of precision and threshold you could use:

ValuePrecisionThresholdResult
50,782.76520.00550,782.77
50,782.76510.0550,782.80
50,782.76500.550,783
50,782.765-1550,780
50,782.765-25050,800
50,782.765-350051,000
50,782.765-4500050,000

entry.title: Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you
entry.content:
Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you

Have you ever been in a situation

  • where you had to create or maintain a key user custom field or create some key user custom logic but wondered which business context, which OData service, which SOAP service, or in general which object you must extend out of the thousands of potential candidates?
  • or where you must figure out which CDS view you should choose as value help provider for your key user custom field out of the thousands of options?
  • or where you know the UI or API service to which you need to add an extension field, but you have no idea which business context or data source needs to be extended?

If your answer is yes, then this blog post is just for you. In this blog, you‚Äôll meet the GenAI-driven Extensibility Assistant, which helps you to master such challenges. Starting with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, the extensibility assistant is available in the Custom Fields Fiori app and in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

You‚Äôll learn how to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user and how to use it.

How to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user

The extensibility assistant belongs to the feature set of Joule for Developers (J4D) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The first step you need to take to make the extensibility assistant available in a system is to ‚Äúactivate‚Äù J4D for the system. How this can be done is described in SAP Note 3571857. You can find more information regarding J4D in general (also regarding the licensing) here: https://www.sap.com/documents/2025/02/b4f714de-f57e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html

Please note that the GenAI-driven extensibility assistant is only available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and only in systems where development is supported:

  • In 3-system landscapes, this is the development system

Once J4D is activated for your system, you need to assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to your user. Please note that you need to use client 100, as the key user extensibility apps are only available there.

You can assign the business catalog in various ways:

  1. copy the extensibility template business role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC to your own role and assign this copied role to your user. You can refer to Maintain Business Roles for further details on how to maintain business roles
  2. assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to another custom business role that you assign to your user

As soon as the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC is assigned to your user, the button ‚ÄúOpen Assistant‚Äù will be active in the Custom Logic and the Custom Fields Fiori app (see screenshots below).

Open Assistant button in Custom Fields and Custom Logic Fiori app

If it turns out that though you followed all the steps described above  still the "Open Assistant" button does not occur please create a customer ticket on application component BC-SRV-APS-EXT-FLD.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app.

When you click ‚ÄúOpen Assistant‚Äù in the Custom Fields Fiori app, the extensibility assistant pops up (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

You can now enter your question or your request in the text box located under the ‚ÄúYour Question‚Äù label.

You‚Äôll notice a question mark icon next to the ‚ÄúYour Question‚Äù label. Clicking the question mark, a popup appears explaining you how to interact with the extensibility assistant, providing you recommendations when it comes to how to formulate your questions, and showing you a set of example questions (see screenshot below):

Explanation popup of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

To understand in detail how to interact with the extensibility assistant, let‚Äôs have a look at a concrete example. Let‚Äôs assume that you were told to create a custom field which should capture an UPS tracking number of parcels belonging to specific sales orders. The field should be included in the OData API for Customer Return documents, as this information is essential for communication with another company.
In general, let‚Äôs say that you know the Custom Fields Fiori app, and you know how to create a custom field (by pressing the + button on the upper left corner of the Custom Fields app).
What you‚Äôll most likely not know is which business context you have to choose out of the more than 500 available ones. You most likely also won‚Äôt know the exact name of the OData API in which you should enable the field.

That is where the extensibility assistant comes in handy. The scenario mentioned above usually consists of the following steps:

1. You enter your question or your request into the question text box. In this case, the text we enter is ‚ÄúCreate a field UPSTrackingNumber and enable it for the customer return OData API‚Äù. As soon as you‚Äôve entered the text and pressed the return button (or clicked on the arrow button on the right), the assistant‚Äôs answer is shown in the ‚ÄúAssistant Response‚Äù text box. It might be for example ‚ÄúI found multiple business contexts related to "customer return". Please choose one of the following options:‚Äù. Please note that on the lower right corner of the ‚ÄúAssistant Response‚Äù text box, there is a link to ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù. Opening the link, you‚Äôll get a list of SAP documentation links like Fiori Apps Library links, Business Accelerator Hub links, and others which have been the knowledge source of the assistant‚Äôs answer. You can click on these links to navigate to these documents. Within the ‚ÄúAssistant Proposal‚Äù box, there are business contexts shown which are relevant to the context of your question. You can simply choose one of them by pressing the select button on the right side of the respective option (see screenshot below).

Select business context

In our case, the UPSTrackingNumber field belongs to the header of the Sales Order document. We‚Äôll choose the business context SD_SALESDOC with the description ‚ÄúSales: Sales Document‚Äù.
Note that the extensibility assistant shows a relevance score telling you how relevant the finding is in the context of your question.

2.As soon as you‚Äôve selected the respective business context, the extensibility assistant responds for example ‚ÄúI found multiple OData APIs related to customer return. Please choose one of the following options to enable the custom field:‚Äù. You‚Äôll see a list of OData API options from which you can choose. Please note that in this case, a column ‚ÄúDocumentation‚Äù is shown which allows you to navigate directly to the documentation of the respective OData API to validate whether this is really the API you were looking for (see screenshot below).

Select OData API
In this case, you select the second-best option, as you prefer to use an OData V2 service and not its OData V4 variant.

3. As soon as you‚Äôve selected the OData API option, the extensibility assistant responds for example ‚ÄúThe custom field UPSTrackingNumber has been prepared for enabling in the OData API Customer Return (A2X) - V2 (API_CUSTOMER_RETURN_SRV~1). Please make sure to save the changes to make them permanent. If you need any further assistance, feel free to ask!‚Äù and proposes an action which you can see in the ‚ÄúProposed Action‚Äù box on the bottom of the extensibility assistant pop-up (see screenshot below).

Proposed Create custom field action

You can now check whether the proposal of the assistant fits your needs and if so, you can simply click ‚ÄúAccept‚Äù on the lower right side of the ‚ÄúProposed Action‚Äù box. With that, the data is handed over to the ‚ÄúCreate Field‚Äù screen of the Custom Fields app (see screenshot below).

Proposal taken over from the extensibility assistant to the ‚ÄúNew Field‚Äù popup

You can check the data once again and change it if needed. There is always a human in-between, and the extensibility assistant never does something on its own within the system.

Please note that instead of clicking ‚ÄúAccept‚Äù, you can continue to chat with the extensibility assistant as it remembers the conversation history. You can, for example, ask the extensibility assistant ‚ÄúWhy did you choose a length of 50 for this field‚Äù and in the ‚ÄúAssistant Response‚Äù the assistant will answer for example ‚ÄúThe length of 50 for the custom field UPSTrackingNumber was chosen as a reasonable default to accommodate typical tracking numbers, which can vary in length depending on the carrier and format. If you have specific requirements or need a different length, please let me know, and I can adjust it accordingly!‚Äù.
You can also ask the assistant to enable the field in further usages like APIs or SOAP services, or any other available location.

Now, we‚Äôve used the extensibility assistant to master our UPSTrackingNumber challenge, where the assistant helped us to identify the correct business context and propagate the field to the OData API where we needed it to be.
The extensibility assistant supports the following scope:

  • Create Custom Fields: It can create new custom fields in various business contexts.
  • Find Business Contexts: It can help you find the right business context to extend for your custom fields.
  • Find Usages: It can identify where custom fields can be used, such as in UIs, APIs, CDS views, transactions, etc.
  • Enable Usages: It can enable custom fields in identified usages (note that email or form templates are not supported).
  • Find Business Scenarios: It can find business scenarios that involve data flow between different business objects.
  • Find Existing Custom Fields: It can locate existing custom fields in specific business contexts.
  • Find Value Helps: It can find value helps that can be used in custom fields.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

Just like in the Custom Fields Fiori app, you can click ‚ÄúOpen Assistant‚Äù in the Custom Logic Fiori app, which opens the extensibility assistant (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

You can now enter your query to find an extension point in the text box located under the ‚ÄúYour Question‚Äù label. As this assistant helps with finding extension points, it‚Äôs recommended to enter a query where you outline what you want your implementation to do. As soon as you have formulated your query, you can press enter or click the send button. After a short wait, you are prompted with extension points that fit your query.

Currently, the assistant doesn‚Äôt support code generation but can only be used to find the correct extension point for your use case. If you are unsure of what the assistant can do, you can ask ‚ÄúWhat can you do?‚Äù to get an answer. In the following section, you find an example on when and how to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

Imagine you get a new requirement for your bill of materials that you need to implement. If your new requirement is not met, the bill of materials should not be saved. To find the extension point that lets you insert custom checks, you tell the assistant ‚ÄúI want to validate my BOM before it is saved‚Äù. Once entered, the assistant prompts you with multiple extension points that might fit your use case (as you can see in the screenshot below):

Extensibility assistant after entering a query

List of references that contain further information and documentation

To choose the right extension point, you can have a look at the extension point‚Äôs documentation or further documents about the shown extension points. You can find that information by clicking the ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù link under the assistant‚Äôs response. There, you‚Äôll find a list of links that will open the resource in your browser. If you click on the extension point‚Äôs documentation, a popup will open containing said documentation. Additionally, you will find the extension point‚Äôs documentation by clicking the link ‚ÄúView Documentation‚Äù in the table.

Popup with the extension point‚Äôs documentation

Once you‚Äôve chosen the right extension point, you can select it from the list and click on ‚ÄúCreate Implementation‚Äù. This will direct you to the creation wizard (see screenshot below). There, the extension point will already be selected for you. From there, you can create the implementation just like you would normally. If you can‚Äôt create an implementation for the selected extension point because it can only be implemented once, you get a warning that tells you which implementation already exists for the selected extension point.

Extension point table after selection

Warning if the extension point is already implemented

Now, we‚Äôve successfully used the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app. The extensibility assistant in this app supports the following scope:

  • Find BAdIs: I can find the right BAdI for your custom implementation.

It currently does not support code generation.

Please note that the extensibility assistant is only available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition so far. The intention is to also make it available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, but we can‚Äôt share any timeline regarding that yet.

Now, you are done! Congratulations!
You successfully used the extensibility assistant to master challenges with key user custom fields and key user custom logic. You have an idea about the scope of the assistant so that you know what it can do for you, and you know what comes next.

Please note that this blog has been elaborated by a team of experts. I want to thank Yasmina van Rooij (YasminavanRooij), Mathis Neunzig (Mathis Neunzig), Christian Holzer (ChristianHolzer), Yannick Schmitt ( yannickschmitt ) , and Karsten Schaser (Karsten_Schaser) for their extremely helpful contributions.

Feedback, Comments, or Questions:

You‚Äôre cordially invited to provide feedback, comments, or questions in the comments section below. Please follow our profiles to get updates when we publish more posts on these topics.
Feel invited to post and answer questions here (https://answers.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26) and read other posts on the topic (https://blogs.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26/).

Other related blog posts:

  1. Key User Custom Fields: When to use what type of code list
  2. Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters
  3. Custom Fields in S/4HANA: How to control field properties like mandatory, read-only, and visibility
  4. SAP S/4HANA Key User Extensibility: Custom field with context-dependent value help
  5. SAP S/4HANA Key User Extensibility powered by Embedded Steampunk: Custom Field with ABAP implemented Value Help

entry.title: SAP BTP ABAP Environment ‚Äì Pre-Upgrade Option for Release 2511
entry.content:
Overview

Providing a significant number of new features is an important goal of release upgrades to deliver innovations to our customers and partners. There are four major release upgrades per year following a predefined schedule as described in this blog post.

An upgrade is intended as a ‚Äúno event‚Äù for customers and partners. For example, only compatible changes of released objects (APIs) will be delivered. We recommend performing a test of the custom-built productive apps in a test environment for the new release. The complexity of the technical dependencies between the custom-built apps and the underlying environment cannot be tested isolated, only including the ABAP environment on SAP-side. Therefore, we offer you to pre-upgrade selected systems 29 days in advance to test the applications prior to the planned standard-upgrade.   

 

Purpose

This option enables a customer or partner to test the applications they have already developed on top of the new release a couple of days before the standard-upgrade. With SAP BTP ABAP Environment (aka "Steampunk"), we follow the approach of keeping released objects stable and provide all enhancements in a compatible fashion. Early testing is an additional measure to ensure proper software quality and might be used to detect unforeseen regressions. However, this option is not intended to test new features or to consume new features earlier.

 

Approach

The standard-upgrade of all systems to release 2511 is planned for November 15/16.

A customer or partner can nominate one or more already existing systems for the pre-upgrade. A nominated system will be upgraded on October 17 within a planned downtime from 8:00 to 16:00 CET. Depending on the system settings, the actual technical downtime might be only ~20 min within the mentioned timeframe. Please refer to this blog post about the downtime-optimized upgrade. 

We recommend nominating a non-development system, such as a test system. The nomination of a development system is technically also possible, but fixes or other changes must not be imported into another system with a lower release. The nomination of a productive system doesn‚Äôt make sense because the purpose of the pre-upgrade is the re-test of the existing application before the productive system gets the new release.

According to the approach explained above, this offer is only relevant for customers or partners having at least two systems.

There might be situations where a correction of custom objects needs to be deployed. Such corrections are possible if the development / correction system is on the older release and is imported into the pre-upgraded system with the higher release.

Except potential fixes, the pre-upgrade is based on the same version as the standard-upgrade. It is planned to perform the pre-upgrade based on hotfix collection 1. The pre-upgrade systems will get the import of hotfix collection 2 after 2 weeks in the middle of the entire pre-upgrade test phase. It is planned to perform the standard-upgrade based on hotfix collection 3 and import this hotfix collection 3 to the pre-upgrade systems on November 15/16 as well.

 

Costs

This offering is optional and free of any additional charges.

 

Planned New Features

The planned new features will be published on the What's New for SAP BTP ABAP Environment on October 17. This list gives you an overview of potential areas for re-testing. The purpose of the pre-upgrade is not to consume these features before the standard-upgrade, because the documentation on help.sap.com will be delivered later before the standard-upgrade. It would also not be possible to transport code of such an adoption, because subsequent systems are not yet on the new release during the pre-upgrade phase.

Independent of the upgrades of the SAP BTP ABAP Environment, we recommend developing automated tests for the custom-built apps to detect regressions early on and without manual effort for re-testing. Such automated tests are perfectly suited to be run in the pre-upgrade test phase.

 

Time Schedule

The following figure summarizes the general approach:

 

Milestones for release 2511:

  • September 16: Nomination of system(s) is possible in the Landscape Portal
  • October 17: Announcement of the planned new features
  • October 13: Pre-upgrade systems are known
  • October 17: Pre-upgrade (with hotfix collection 1)
  • November 1/2: Import of hotfix collection 2 into pre-upgrade systems
  • November 12: Potential decision to postpone the upgrade
  • November 15/16: Standard-upgrade (with hotfix collection 3)

 

System Nomination

To nominate a system, please register the system(s) by October 13 (EOB) latest by using the Landscape Portal. You can find further information about Accessing the Landscape Portal and about Register Systems for Pre-Upgrade. Please do not create customer tickets for system nomination like in previous pre-upgrades.

With such a nomination, the customer agrees to an extraordinary planned maintenance on October 17 (see above).

 

Report an Issue

Issues should be reported as part of the regression test phase by October 31 (EOB) to allow for a sufficient time frame for issue analysis and potential corrections on SAP-side.

Please create a customer ticket by using component BC-CP-ABA.

If a detected issue is likely to endanger the productive use after the standard-upgrade, you should use ticket priority very high despite the fact that the pre-upgrade system is not a productive system.

 

Exceptional Process in Case of Unresolved Priority Very High Issues

In case of the aligned decision on Wednesday, November 12 (based on unresolved priority very high tickets) to postpone the upgrade, a dedicated mitigation process needs to be started together with the respective customer or partner, with the following boundary conditions:

  • Resolving the open priority very high issues remains the highest priority for both, SAP and the customer or partner, as it is also the prerequisite for the upgrade.
  • According to the estimated issue resolution, catching up the upgrade needs to be planned.
  • The upgrade leads to a business downtime of 6 ‚Äì 8 hours.
  • The upgrade must be scheduled within 7 calendar days the latest after fixing all remaining open priority very high issues.
  • We will not provide any fixes for the old release after the original date of the standard-upgrade to the new release.

In case business-critical issues are detected after the upgrade:

  • Issues need to be reported as priority very high issues and will be processed accordingly.
  • Going back to the release before upgrade is not an option. Therefore, resolving the issues in the new release with the appropriate priority is the required approach.

 

Summary

We recommend performing regression tests in pre-upgraded test systems to avoid day-1 impacts of productive custom apps after the standard-upgrade.

entry.title: Re: Material price change error in MSC2N t-code .
entry.content:
This error typically occurs when the material is batch-managed and uses automatic batch valuation. The valuation type is derived from the batch itself. The system interprets a change in classification as a valuation-relevant change, which would affect pricing or valuation data.

In your case the material 910992 is activated with automatic batch valuation. Changing the characteristic Z023_TRANS_2_HEXENAL may trigger a valuation update. However, since the batch has already been used in transactions (e.g., goods movements, accounting entries), price changes are locked to preserve consistency. SAP prevents valuation changes mid-period if actual data has already been posted for that batch/material combination.

Below are some workaround options

  • If the characteristic is valuation-relevant, SAP treats changes as price-impacting. You can check this in transaction CT04 for the characteristic ‚Üí see if ‚ÄúValuation-relevant‚Äù is flagged. If flagged, consider removing that flag (requires careful impact analysis).
  • If Material Ledger is active, price changes are tightly controlled. You can only change valuation-relevant data before any postings in the period.
  • If the change is essential and cannot be made to the existing batch, consider creating a new batch with the correct characteristic value.

Have a look at SAP note 958105 which explains error handling in valuation type changes

entry.title: Re: How to use SWFVISU to open SAP GUI transaction.
entry.content:
Hi,

By default ‚ÄúObject Visualization‚Äù in My Inbox uses Business Client/WebGUI. To open a Fiori app instead you must configure Intent-Based Navigation in the backend.

Steps:

  1. In SWFVISU find your Task ID.

  2. Change Visualization Type to Intent-Based Navigation.

  3. Fill the Visualization params:
    ‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Semantic Object ‚Äì e.g. PurchaseOrder
    ‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Action ‚Äì e.g. display
    ‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ System Alias ‚Äì your front-end server alias.

  4. In the parameter table, map workflow context keys to the app‚Äôs parameters (e.g. PurchaseOrder=<PO_NUMBER>).

  5. Make sure the Fiori app is active in /UI2/FLPD_CUST and its OData service in /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE.

  6. Clear cache (/UI2/INVALIDATE_GLOBAL_CACHES) and test from My Inbox.

Once this is set up, clicking the work item launches the Fiori app directly instead of WebGUI.

entry.title: Re: Bad Request with HTTP Reciever Adapter with OAuth2 Cl...
entry.content: Here the curl call, that works

entry.title: Re: Sales based contract difference variable amount post...
entry.content:
Yes quite possible to achieve your requirement. SAP RE-FX under IFRS 16 does support sales-based lease contracts with valuation. To make this work as described, your system must have:

  • a valuation rule that includes only the fixed rent condition.
  • a condition group that separates valuation-relevant (fixed rent) from non-valuation-relevant (sales-based rent).
  • sales-based condition set up to post as a separate expense when actual sales exceed the fixed threshold.
  • monthly actual sales data posted to trigger variable rent calculation.

entry.title: Re: Bad Request with HTTP Reciever Adapter with OAuth2 Cl...
entry.content: curl --request POST \ --url https://<api-url> \ --header 'content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \ --data client_id=<id> \ --data client_secret=<secret>

entry.title: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

We wanted to know how does SAP store the Traceability log, we saw no pattern in viewing previous traceability log and wanted confirmation on if there is any setting that needs to be updated from our end to have it visible for sometime before its no more valid.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content:
Traceability logs are stored only for thirty days. If you need to consult a traceability log at a later time, download it to your hard drive or store it in a remote folder location.

If you want to make sure that a traceability log is generated for each job run, for example to allow for seamless monitoring or to facilitate auditability, you can force generate traceability logs by configuring the data mapping definition as follows.

Force Generate Traceability Logs
The Generate Traceability Log: For Each Job Run option is especially useful when traceability logs are stored on remote folder locations. For more information, see

 Configure Destinations for Remotely Stored Folders or CSV Files

entry.title: Re: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content: Traceability logs are stored only for thirty days. If you need to consult a traceability log at a later time, download it to your hard drive or store it in a remote folder location. If you want to make sure that a traceability log is generated for each job run, for example to allow for seamless monitoring or to facilitate auditability, you can force generate traceability logs by configuring the data mapping definition as follows. ‚Ä¢ Force Generate Traceability Logs The Generate Traceability Log: For Each Job Run option is especially useful when traceability logs are stored on remote folder locations. For more information, see Configure Destinations for Remotely Stored Folders or CSV Files

entry.title: Re: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Group_Reporting_Data_Collection/64dc0138def94c6696ee1ed4701d53f7/70a94ba8ad724643b865774a25ed3f55.html?version=1.0

entry.title: Re: Document type MK not allowed with doc. category F (Pl...
entry.content:
When you reference a contract in a PO item, SAP automatically switches the PO document type to match the contract type. In your case, the contract is likely a value contract (MK). Value contracts are associated with document category F. However, your PO document type NB is for standard POs which conflicts with the contract reference. So when you enter the contract reference, SAP switches the PO type to MK but then throws the error - "Document type MK not allowed with doc. category F". This means either the document type MK is not configured properly for category F, or you‚Äôre trying to use a standard PO type (NB) with a value contract, which isn‚Äôt allowed.

Below are the options which you can try

Instead of NB, use a PO document type that is configured for document category F and allows referencing value contracts.

If the contract is a value contract (MK), you must use a release order type that supports it. If you intended to use a quantity contract (WK), recreate the contract accordingly.

entry.title: Re: Project Kernseife - improving the measurement of Clean Core in ABAP
entry.content:
Hi @insungbang,

Thanks a lot for your question.

Partner files:
While the standard check (Note 3565942) is referring to the "standard" classification for classic and not-recommended APIs. For SAP content, it is stored in the file objectClassifications_SAP.json or see here in Cloudification Repository. Partners can create their own "classic API" classification and then you can upload the file as well through the SYCM_API_CLASSIFICATAION_MANAGR.

Kernseife Classification:
To not re-invent the wheel, we aligned with the classification approach technically. By this, we can re-use the same mechanism to upload a classification through our own ZKNSF_CLASSIFICATION_MANAGR.
But let me be clear, we use the same mechanism, but it is intended to upload you CUSTOM classification consumed by the Kernseife ATC Check. So the file containing e.g. the information, that contains all the ratings for Kernseife (e.g. BF1 for all classic APIs, but also for your individual adjustments, like "/SCWM/CL_RF*" in the example above) is uploaded like this to the system.

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Re: Harnessing Half a Century of Knowledge: SAP's Journey of Enriching APIs with Business Metadata
entry.content:
MCP (Model Context Protocol) could become the open standard for the AI agentic era. More and more software vendors are providing pre-built integrations: APIs will offer out-of-the-box contextual meta-tagging to MCP, describing ‚Äúwhat the API is doing.‚Äù This allows LLMs to understand both what they read (e.g., reporting data) and what they write (e.g., agentic functions via the API).

Do you have some information that SAP is using their meta data for MCP?

entry.title: Re: Can I deliver a custom theme to all subscribers of my...
entry.content:
I can provide a update on using a custom theme within a launchpad module (tested with build workzone instance - documentation based on old portal service).

Advantage: Provider Account Theme can be used in Subscribed Applications, without transporting/creation of themes in Subscriber Account (used via URL)

In a Multitenant Scenario (Should also work single tenant, little adjustments necessary there - but approuter required)

  1. Create Custom Theme in your Multitenant Provider Account
  2. Create UI Theme Designer Instance (technical name: theming - plan: standard)
  3. Create Service Key for that UI Theme Designer Instance
  4. Go to Subscriber Account
  5. Create a destination for example: theming-service
    TypeHTTP
    Proxy TypeInternet
    URLfrom Service Key (endpoints.runtime) for example: https://theming-runtime.cfapps.<cflandscape>.hana.ondemand.com
    AuthenticationOAuth2ClientCredentials
    Client IDfrom Service Key (clientid)
    Client Secret from Service Key (clientsecret)
    Token Service URLfrom Service Key (uaa.url) but append "/oauth/token" for example:
    https://<subaccount>.authentication.<cflandscape>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token
    Token Service URL TypeDedicated
  6. Configuration in xs-app.json of application router. Routes need to be added:
    This config will redirect theme request to your provider subaccount
{
    "source": "^/themes$", 
    "target": "/themeroot/v1", 
    "destination": "theming-service"
},
{ 
    "source": "^/themes/(.*)$",
    "target": "/themeroot/v1/$1", 
    "destination": "theming-service"
},
{
      "source": "^/comsapuitheming.runtime/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "theming-service"
}‚Äã

7.  Usage in LaunpadModule or directly in index.html(when approuter points directly to index.html of application)

When using in Launchpad Module it's important to use ui5LibraryUrl instead of ui5VersionNumber, otherwise it will not work! Site Settings documentation: Configuring Site Settings | SAP Help Portal

Relevant for setting the theme is: sap-ui-theme=<custom-theme-id>@/themes Reference: Setting Themes - Documentation - Demo Kit - SAPUI5 SDK

  • Example for Launchpad Module: https://<subscription-app-router-url>/cp.portal/site?sap-ui-theme=<your-custom-theme-id>@/themes#Shell-home
  • Standalone/direct access via index.html: https://<subscription-app-router-url>/<appid(fetchedfromManifestJson)/index.html?sap-ui-theme=<your-custom-theme-id>@/themes

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports 2008: Cannot use linked parameter for...
entry.content: Thank you for your response. Your statement is correct: a single parameter maintains the same value for all records. However, this appears to be a misunderstanding of my implementation strategy. My goal is not to sort by the parameter's constant value itself, but to use the parameter as a conditional input to control the sorting logic for a large dataset. The sorting is applied to the data records, not the parameter. The core of our report architecture is as follows: Our main report is designed to call the Process_Info SQL stored procedure only once. This single call retrieves all the necessary data for three separate subreports. Each subreport requires a different sorting order for its specific business logic: Subreport 1: Requires chronological sorting (Chrono_DT). Subreport 2: Requires sorting by batch number (Batch_Number). Subreport 3: Requires sorting by a third unique key. The performance benefit is clear: Current, inefficient method: Each subreport connects to the database and calls the Process_Info stored procedure separately, resulting in three redundant database calls and slow execution. Desired, efficient method: The main report makes one call to the stored procedure. The dataset is cached, and each subreport accesses this cached data, applying its unique sorting without a new database call. The issue is that when a parameter is linked from the main report to a subreport, it is not available in the subreport's Group Expert to serve as the conditional variable for dynamic sorting. Our request is for a reliable method to use a linked variable or field to control the subreport's sorting on its cached data. This is a fundamental requirement for optimizing report performance by reducing database round-trips.

entry.title: Re: Sales based contract difference variable amount post...
entry.content: Use a Separate Condition for Variable Rent and define a non-valuation-relevant condition for variable rent (e.g., ZVAR). Configure it to calculate only the excess over the fixed rent threshold. This may require a custom calculation formula or enhancement via BAdI RECD_COND_CALC. You can store the threshold (‚Çπ10,000) as a reference value in the condition master or contract parameters. Use it in your calculation logic to compare against actual sales-based rent. With the BAdI suggested above, override standard percentage-based calculation. Continue posting actual sales via RE-FX sales interface or manual entry. This triggers the variable rent calculation each month.

entry.title: Re: Bad Request with HTTP Reciever Adapter with OAuth2 Client Credential
entry.content: not sure if I get you right, but since calling an API using OAuth2.0 requires 2 steps and your error is "Bad Request" I would guess authorization (Step 1) is successful but the actual call against the API (Step 2) is not understood by the sever. i.e. CI performs the call to get a token, receives a token and subsequently calls the API and this is when the error is raised. Do you sent a "valid" request in terms of API spec.?

entry.content:
Hi Fabrice,

Yes, students can take the C_TS4FI_2021 certification if they meet the exam registration requirements. For preparation, you might also want to look at Pass4Exams, where you can find practice questions, mock exams, PDFs, and an online test engine that can really help with exam readiness. Regarding languages, SAP does offer certain exams in French and German, so it‚Äôs best to check the availability for your chosen certification when you book it.

entry.title: Re: Field InventoryStockType cannot be set for this opera...
entry.content:
From your Payload details, below are the Key observations

  • InventoryStockType = "02" ‚Üí This refers to Quality Inspection stock.
  • StorageLocation = "" ‚Üí No storage location provided.
  • GoodsMovementType = "101" ‚Üí Standard GR for production or purchase.
  • Batch and Manufacturing Order are provided ‚Üí Suggests GR against production order.

Please note even for QI stock, Storage Location is mandatory in most scenarios. SAP needs to know where to place the stock physically, even if it's under inspection. For QI stock to be posted, the Inspection Type (e.g., 01 for GR) must be active in the Material Master (QM view). Check if the material 000000000000001594 has an inspection type assigned for plant 02BP. Custom fields like YY1_Chilled_Exp_Date_MMI and YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI may have validation logic. Ensure /Date(0)/ for frozen expiry isn‚Äôt causing a rejection. Sticker number format of "55528-[]" might be failing validation if the system expects a specific format.

In order to fix this,

  • add a valid storage location in the payload for plant 02BP.
  • Go to material master QM View for material 1594 in plant 02BP. Ensure Inspection Type 01 is active and properly configured.
  • Ensure all custom date fields are valid and not defaulted to zero. If YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI is not applicable, consider omitting it or using a valid date.
  • If 55528-[] is not accepted, try a clean format like 55528 or 55528-01
